It argues that Henin's expertise in languages (Dutch, Arabic, and Spanish) and his skills as a translator and negotiator allowed him to build a career as a mediator between these powers, which were separated by religious, political and economical rivalries. Henin positioned himself as a practical man capable of ensuring the reform and success of the Spanish monarchy, due to his experience and services to both sides. The article is a study of his writings to illustrate how his profession allowed him to grow within the Hispanic Monarchy.
